channel.title: Exceptions as Control Flow :: Introduction to Web Dev
channel.description: Runtime errors occur as the program runs, and they are also called exceptions. Exceptions are caused by referencing undeclared variables and invalid or unexpected data. Control Flow The control flow of a program is the order in which the statements are executed. Normal control flow runs from top to bottom of a file. An exception breaks the normal flow and stops the program. A stopped program can no longer interact with the user. Luckily JavaScript provides a way to anticipate and handle exceptions.
